rubric.long_description: Use one to two paragraphs to explain the project implementation plans

ratings.long_description: The implementation plan is complete and describes all requirements
The implementation plan is missing and/or incomplete

rubric.long_description: Recognize professional responsibilities and make informed judgments in computing practice based on legal and ethical principles.

assignments.description:
Prompt

Reflect on the following points and respond in detail:

  1. Kernel vs. User Space:
    Explain how the boundary between user space and kernel space enforces protection and stability in Linux.
    Why must device drivers operate within kernel space?

  2. Parallelism:
    Compare how Linux kernel threads manage CPU concurrency versus how CUDA threads manage GPU parallelism.
    How do scheduling and synchronization differ between the two?

  3. Memory Management:
    Discuss the differences between Linux memory management (virtual memory, paging) and CUDA’s memory hierarchy (global, shared, and constant memory).
    How do these differences affect performance and programming complexity?

  4. Synchronization:
    Analyze the role of synchronization mechanisms such as spinlocks, semaphores, and __syncthreads().
    When would each be most appropriate, and what trade-offs do they involve?

  5. Real-World Connection:
    Give one real or hypothetical example of a system or application that benefits from both kernel-level programming and GPU acceleration (e.g., network packet filtering, AI computation, real-time image processing).
assignments.name: What is CUDA and the Kernel? How Do They Relate?

rubric.long_description: Wrote at least 200–250 words addressing the prompt in a single, well-structured post.
Responded to at least two classmates with meaningful feedback, extensions, or counter-points (at least 75 words each).
Used proper technical vocabulary (e.g., “context switch,” “warp,” “semaphore,” etc.).
Included one citation (APA or IEEE style) from the Linux or CUDA documentation, NVIDIA whitepapers, or reputable academic sources.

discussion_topic.title: What is CUDA and the Kernel? How Do They Relate?
